dublin_core.dcvalue: We provide a systematic review of interventions utilizing mobile technology to alter physical activity PA sedentary behavior SB and sleep among adults aged 50 A systematic search identified 52 relevant articles RCT quasi experimental pre post single group design Of 50 assessing PA 17 out of 29 RCTs and 13 out of 21 assessed for pre post change only supported the effectiveness of mobile interventions to improve PA and 9 5 out of 10 RCTs and all 4 pre post studies out of 14 reduced SB Only 2 of 5 interventions improved sleep 1 out of 2 RCTs and 1 out of 3 pre post Text messaging was most frequently used 60 of all studies but usually in combination with other components 79 of hybrid interventions included SMS plus either web or app components Although more high quality RCTs are needed there is evidence supporting the effectiveness of mHealth approaches in those aged 50
Made available in DSpace on 2020-06-08T14:31:37Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2-11-30
Journal of aging and physical activity
Mobile Health Interventions for Physical Activity, Sedentary Behavior, and Sleep in Adults Aged 50+: A Systematic Literature Review.
